description: Replacement of windows from single glazed, sash timber to double glazed, sash timber and installation of double glazed, timber framed casement window to side elevation (existing outrigger)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: Proposed Plans:-  Proposed Floor Plans and Elevations drawing no.1618/03 and Proposed Front elevation drawing no.1618/05 and email received 5/5/2020 stating glazing confirmation that the depth of the double glazing and its position in the frame will be such that the exterior of the glass should be in the same position relative to the exterior of the frame as the original windows. The fixing is to be the same depth as the original putty fixing; spacers will be white, glazing fixed with putty or putty substitute and proposed horns on the opening sliding sashes will be identical to the horns on the existing sliding sash windows.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing dwelling house and shall be consistent with those as listed within the submitted application form and the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surrounding area, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policies 1.1 (g) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012), policies D2, D4 and HC1 of the Draft New London Plan 2019, policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan 2016 and National Planning Policy Framework 2019 sections 12 and 16.
